Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CcAMP1 (natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide most resembles (36.8% similarity)RAINBOW TROUT Oncorhyncin I. Mol Wt: 3051.595; Mol Extinction coeff 7165; mol formula: C134H222N39O36S2. Active against Gram+ S. aureus (MIC 12.5 uM), B. subtilis (6.3 uM), M. Luteus (12.5 uM), S. pneumoniae (6.3 uM); Gram- E. coli, P. solanacearum (MIC 6.3 uM), S. typhi (MIC 6.3 uM), and S. dysenteriae (1.6 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Li S, Zhao B, Du J (2015)
Literature Information.Title: Isolation, purification, and detection of the antimicrobial activity of the antimicrobial peptide CcAMP1 from Coridius chinensis (Hemiptera: Dinidoridae)
